skill.name: langchain-architecture
skill.description: Design LLM applications using the LangChain framework with agents, memory, and tool integration patterns. Use when building LangChain applications, implementing AI agents, or creating complex LLM workflows.
skill.summary: Design LLM applications using the LangChain framework with agents, memory, and tool integration patt...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is static documentation with example code blocks. No executable scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment access are present. Behavior matches the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: You need a clear architecture for LangChain agents, chains, memory, and retrieval. This skill provides patterns, examples, and checklists to design reliable LLM applications.
actual_capabilities: Explain LangChain agent types and selection criteria
Provide chain composition patterns with sample code
Describe memory options and usage guidance
Show callback handler structure for observability
List testing strategies and performance optimizations
limitations: Does not execute or validate code examples
Does not include API keys, deployment steps, or hosting guidance
Referenced assets and additional files are not included
No direct integration with external services

use_cases.title: Plan an agent workflow
use_cases.description: Define tools, memory, and error handling for a support assistant.

use_cases.title: Design a RAG pipeline
use_cases.description: Pick loaders, splitters, vector stores, and retrievers for document QA.

use_cases.title: Create team standards
use_cases.description: Create a reusable architecture checklist for reviews and onboarding.

prompt_templates.title: Agent selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a LangChain agent type for a scheduling assistant that uses two tools and short conversations.

prompt_templates.title: Chain planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a SequentialChain for extract, analyze, summarize with required inputs and outputs.

prompt_templates.title: RAG design
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a RAG pipeline using loaders, text splitting, embeddings, vector store, and RetrievalQA.

prompt_templates.title: Production architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a production LangChain architecture with memory strategy, callbacks, testing plan, and performance optimizations.

output_examples.input: Design a LangChain RAG pipeline for internal policy documents
output: Select a loader that supports your document formats and metadata
Split text into consistent chunks with overlap for context
Store embeddings in a vector store with a retriever interface
Use RetrievalQA and return sources for traceability

best_practices: Choose memory type based on context length and cost
Add callbacks to monitor latency, errors, and token use
Validate tool descriptions with tests and edge cases
anti_patterns: Using unlimited buffer memory in long sessions
Vague tool descriptions that confuse agents
Skipping error handling and retry limits

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is model agnostic and works with those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides architecture guidance and examples, not runnable code or deployments.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my project?
faq.answer: Apply the patterns to your agents, chains, memory, and retrieval components.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It is static documentation and does not access user data.

faq.question: What if my agent chooses the wrong tool?
faq.answer: Improve tool descriptions, add tests, and review callback logs.

faq.question: How is it different from general LangChain docs?
faq.answer: It focuses on architecture patterns, pitfalls, and checklists.
